description:
### ESnet Traffic Map

This high level map of ESnet highlights the sites
ESnet serves, the structure of the network and the current traffic load.  More
information about each node and edge on the map is available by clicking on
that node or edge.

In order to increase the legibility of this map two simplifications have been systematically applied.

1. The connectivity for each site is shown as a single pair of lines which show
the traffic traversing all connections to the site. This simplification means
that this map does not show the fault tolerance which has been carefully
engineered to provide the sites with highly available connectivity. An
additional map is under development which will show this fault tolerance at
some cost to legibility.

2. The second simplification is that for any pair of nodes shown there is only
a single pair of lines representing all of the connections between that pair
of nodes.

For the transatlantic extension, only the structure of the European section of the network is shown at this time. In the future the CERN site will be depicted with more details. There is more information about the current status of the transatlantic extension available [here](/network/eex).
name: routed_toplevel
